creator: kelsey.grant@orion.co.nz
text:
If you change the locale of the browser, and make a request to tomcat, the 
Locale retrieved inside a servlet (using response.getLocale()) is always the 
default locale of the server. It completely ignores the locale passed in by the 
browser.

The configuration is the AJP13 connector in tomcat 4.0.2, using the current 
ISAPI redirector inside IIS.

I encounter the same problem in Apache-Tomcat via AJP 1.3 environment. Although 
request.getHeader("accept-language"); returns valid accept-language string, 
request.getLocales() returns enumeration with single server locale.

For now my solution will be to take parseAcceptLanguage method from Tomcat's 
source.
